title: Stop syncing sporadically

body: The log looks OK. What makes you think it stops sometimes.
The logs seem sane to me. 200ms import at the top, latest block. Then nothing happens, eventually at the end of your logs 2 more blocks come in. Why do you suspect something's wrong?

I'm calling `.getBlockNumber()` via `ethers.providers.JsonRpcProvider(enode)` and the block number returned is behind my other Parity nodes, Geth nodes, Infura and Etherscan.  I'm making this call to decide if the Geth node should be included in the load-balanced pool of RPC interfaces. 

Secondly, I have a process that exports transactions and that process does not find any new blocks and transactions to export. 

It could be that I have sliced out log entries that aren't related to the issue - but I don't know what I'm looking for.  What can I do to provide more information?
I think just the info logs would be a good start. The block import times are visible there, also if there are inconsistent times, multiple-blocks arriving at the same time, etc.
Closing this, since op hasn't responded since june
